nodes.description: Abedi was born and raised in Manchester in 1994.
nodes.support_text: Abedi, the second youngest of four children, grew up in a Muslim household but matured into a university dropout with an appetite for bloodshed.

nodes.description: Abedi's parents, Samia Tabbal and Ramadan Abedi, are Libyan-born refugees who fled to the UK to escape Gaddafi.
nodes.support_text: His parents, mother Samia Tabbal and father Ramadan Abedi, a security officer, are Libyan-born refugees who fled to the UK to escape Gaddafi.

nodes.description: Abedi's family is known to the Libyan community in Manchester.
nodes.support_text: The family were known to the Libyan community in the city and described Abedi as 'normal'.

nodes.description: Abedi is believed to have attended the Manchester Islamic Centre.
nodes.support_text: Abedi is believed to have attended the Manchester Islamic Centre, also known as the Didsbury Mosque.

nodes.description: Sheikh Mohammad Saeed said Abedi displayed a 'face of hate' after a sermon denouncing terrorism.
nodes.support_text: Sheikh Mohammad Saeed said Abedi had displayed a 'face of hate' after the imam gave a sermon denouncing terrorism.

nodes.description: Abedi has an older brother Ismail Abedi, a younger brother Hashim Abedi, and a sister Jomana.
nodes.support_text: Abedi is thought to have an older brother Ismail Abedi, who was born in Westminster in 1993, a younger brother Hashim Abedi, and a sister Jomana, whose Facebook profile suggests she is from Tripoli and lives in Manchester.

edges.support_text: Abedi, the second youngest of four children, grew up in a Muslim household but matured into a university dropout with an appetite for bloodshed.
His parents, mother Samia Tabbal and father Ramadan Abedi, a security officer, are Libyan-born refugees who fled to the UK to escape Gaddafi.
The family were known to the Libyan community in the city and described Abedi as 'normal'.
Abedi is believed to have attended the Manchester Islamic Centre, also known as the Didsbury Mosque.
